reviewText: This is an absolutely fantastic movie.  The cause is as just as they come.  I was disappointment to see that people were selling used copies.  The point of the movie is to raise money for the cause. People should go to dariusgoeswest.org and support the cause.  Buying this movie for $6 may save you money, but it won't support the movement.  Either way, watch it and buy a copy for a friend.

Darius Goes West is the story of Darius Weems, a 15 year old boy handicapped by Duchette's Muscular Dystrophy, and the trip of a lifetime across the country from Athens, Georgia to Los Angeles California to convince MTV's Pimp My Ride to pimp his wheelchair.  The movie will literally make you laugh and cry, and will leave you feeling inspired to make the most of your life.  Highly recommended for anyone who has a heart.

People should go to dariusgoeswest.org and support the cause.  Buying this movie for $6 may save you money, but it won't support the movement.  Either way, watch it and buy a copy for a friend.

Darius Goes West is the story of Darius Weems, a 15 year old boy handicapped by Duchette's Muscular Dystrophy, and the trip of a lifetime across the country from Athens, Georgia to Los Angeles California to convince MTV's Pimp My Ride to pimp his wheelchair.  The movie will literally make you laugh and cry, and will leave you feeling inspired to make the most of your life.  Highly recommended for anyone who has a heart.
This was a great story.  Showed this to my high school students during our muscular system.  Very good.
Great story. I wish it were in Spanish to share with our friends.
Great moving story, showing that you can do a lot with a strong spirit and great friends to help.  It also was very informative about MD and how much more we can do to help those with it.

Loved it. Darius and his friends were very entertaining and enlightening at the same time.  They gave light to the many challenges that the disabled face in real life. Made me think of ways that I can make an impact in the disability world. Darius himself is one brave and determined person, as well as the deep friendship they all formed is amazing.
I showed this to my middle school students and they loved it; such an inspiring story. The students were fully engaged.
This video was a fabulous documentary that I have and will continue to use in my physical therapy courses to raise awareness about DMD and advocacy!
